title: Unauthenticated hidden groups disclosure via Ajax groups search

activities.message:
@jdgrimes A question for you from @boonebgorges in the aforementioned email thread:

I've reviewed and confirmed your report about hidden group disclosure. One question. You say that the bp-default theme has an additional exploit vector at the 'search_terms' parameter, because it's not urlencoded() before being sent to the template functions (bp_has_groups(), etc). I can't reproduce this. bp_dtheme_ajax_querystring() pulls 'search_terms' directly from $_POST, not the urldecoded $BP_COOKIE, and so its values continue to be URL encoded when the querystring is reassembled. See https://github.com/buddypress/BP-Default/blob/28530c63212c81458bbb0c3e4f10333943810fd7/_inc/ajax.php#L136. Could you please confirm, or let me know if I'm missing something?

@jdgrimes followed up privately about that last question.

I'll have an update soon about patches and plans.

Hi @jdgrimes - Thanks for your patience while the BP team took a closer look at your report.

We've prepared two patches, one for BuddyPress itself and one for the bp-default theme (which we maintain in a separate repo and pull in only at build time). They're attached to this ticket. If you've got a moment, please look them over to verify that they address the vulnerability.

We are currently planning to release BuddyPress 2.9.2, which will contain this fix as well as those in #263694, on Thursday, November 2. I'll update this ticket if anything changes in the meantime.
I've tested both patches and they appear to fix the issue.
